articles.headline: Vague on Details, Trump Is Betting on ‘Special Bond’ With Kim to Deliver Deal
articles.snippet: It is a huge gamble, based on the assumption that the force of Mr. Trump’s personality, and the deal-making skills in which he has supreme confidence, will make all the difference.
articles.abstract: It is a huge gamble, based on the assumption that the force of Mr. Trump’s personality, and the deal-making skills in which he has supreme confidence, will make all the difference.
articles.lead_paragraph: SINGAPORE — On paper, there is nothing President Trump extracted from North Korea’s leader, Kim Jong-un, in their summit meeting that Mr. Kim’s father and grandfather had not already given to past American presidents.

articles.headline: Seattle Officials Repeal Tax That Upset Amazon
articles.snippet: The Seattle City Council repealed the tax in a 7-to-2 vote that was accompanied by acrimony and accusations. Less than a month ago, it had passed unanimously.
articles.abstract: The Seattle City Council repealed the tax in a 7-to-2 vote that was accompanied by acrimony and accusations. Less than a month ago, it had passed unanimously.
articles.lead_paragraph: Seattle officials scuttled a corporate tax on Tuesday that they had wholeheartedly endorsed just a month ago, delivering a win for the measure’s biggest opponent — Amazon — and offering a warning to cities bidding for the retailer’s second headquarters that the company would go to the limit to get its way.
articles.byline: By David Streitfeld and Claire Ballentine

articles.headline: The Trump-Kim Summit Was Unprecedented, but the Statement Was Vague
articles.snippet: President Trump used flattery, cajolery and a slick film in his quest to persuade North Korea’s leader to give up nuclear arms. But he got no guarantees.
articles.abstract: President Trump used flattery, cajolery and a slick film in his quest to persuade North Korea’s leader to give up nuclear arms. But he got no guarantees.
articles.lead_paragraph: SINGAPORE — In a day of personal diplomacy that began with a choreographed handshake and ended with a freewheeling news conference, President Trump deepened his wager on North Korea’s leader on Tuesday, arguing that their rapport would bring the swift demise of that country’s nuclear program.

articles.headline: AT&T Wins Approval for $85.4 Billion Time Warner Deal in Defeat for Justice Dept.
articles.snippet: The Trump administration had sued to block the AT&T-Time Warner deal, arguing that it would lead to fewer choices and higher prices for consumers.
articles.abstract: The Trump administration had sued to block the AT&T-Time Warner deal, arguing that it would lead to fewer choices and higher prices for consumers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A federal judge on Tuesday approved the blockbuster merger between AT&T and Time Warner, rebuffing the government’s effort to stop the $85.4 billion deal, in a decision that is expected to unleash a wave of corporate takeovers.
articles.byline: By Cecilia Kang, Edmund Lee and Emily Cochrane

articles.headline: The Political Legacy of a Failed Challenge to the AT&T-Time Warner Deal
articles.snippet: The Justice Department never should have opposed the AT&T-Time Warner merger. Now a chastened government might not intervene when it should.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department never should have opposed the AT&T-Time Warner merger. Now a chastened government might not intervene when it should.
articles.lead_paragraph: Whether it was or not, the case always felt political.

articles.headline: Comcast and 21st Century Fox in Focus After AT&T-Time Warner Approval
articles.snippet: Comcast could announce its own offer for 21st Century Fox’s assets on Wednesday, triggering a bidding war with Disney for a chunk of Rupert Murdoch’s media empire.
articles.abstract: Comcast could announce its own offer for 21st Century Fox’s assets on Wednesday, triggering a bidding war with Disney for a chunk of Rupert Murdoch’s media empire.
articles.lead_paragraph: [UPDATE: Comcast has announced a $65 billion all cash offer for most of 21st Century Fox. Read the latest on the bid here.]

articles.headline: Ryan Sets Votes on Immigration as Moderates’ Revolt Falls Short
articles.snippet: After late-night talks among Republicans, Speaker Paul D. Ryan promised votes on two immigration bills, one from hard-liners and an unfinished compromise measure.
articles.abstract: After late-night talks among Republicans, Speaker Paul D. Ryan promised votes on two immigration bills, one from hard-liners and an unfinished compromise measure.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After frenzied late-night negotiations, Speaker Paul D. Ryan defused a moderate Republican rebellion on Tuesday with a promise to hold high-stakes votes on immigration next week, thrusting the divisive issue onto center stage during a difficult election season for Republicans.
articles.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Thomas Kaplan

articles.headline: Republican Voters Embrace Trump-Style Candidates
articles.snippet: Mark Sanford, a frequent critic of the president, was ousted from his South Carolina House seat, while a firebrand Trump supporter won a Senate bid in Virginia.
articles.abstract: Mark Sanford, a frequent critic of the president, was ousted from his South Carolina House seat, while a firebrand Trump supporter won a Senate bid in Virginia.
articles.lead_paragraph: Republican voters lashed out against traditional party leaders Tuesday, ousting Representative Mark Sanford of South Carolina and nominating a conservative firebrand for Senate in Virginia, the latest illustration that fealty to President Trump and his hard-line politics is paramount on the right.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: Humanitarian Crisis Worsens in Yemen After Attack on Port
articles.snippet: United Nations officials and others said that hundreds of thousands could starve if the assault drags on, closing a vital gateway for relief supplies.
articles.abstract: United Nations officials and others said that hundreds of thousands could starve if the assault drags on, closing a vital gateway for relief supplies.
articles.lead_paragraph: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates — An Arab military coalition invaded Yemen’s main Red Sea port on Wednesday, worsening what is already the world’s most severe humanitarian disaster by disrupting the delivery of food and other supplies to millions of Yemenis.
articles.byline: By Margaret Coker and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Who Is Behind Trump’s Links to Arab Princes? A Billionaire Friend
articles.snippet: The connections nurtured by the financier Tom Barrack look to have paid off handsomely for Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates — and for his business.
articles.abstract: The connections nurtured by the financier Tom Barrack look to have paid off handsomely for Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates — and for his business.
articles.lead_paragraph: The billionaire financier Tom Barrack was caught in a bind.

articles.headline: Bitcoin’s Price Was Artificially Inflated, Fueling Skyrocketing Value, Researchers Say
articles.snippet: A University of Texas team found evidence that a cryptocurrency boom may have been largely due to manipulation.
articles.abstract: A University of Texas team found evidence that a cryptocurrency boom may have been largely due to manipulation.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A concentrated campaign of price manipulation may have accounted for at least half of the increase in the price of Bitcoin and other big cryptocurrencies last year, according to a paper released on Wednesday by an academic with a history of spotting fraud in financial markets.

articles.headline: Fed Raises Interest Rates and Signals 2 More Increases Are Coming
articles.snippet: Jerome H. Powell, the Federal Reserve chairman, said the economy had strengthened significantly since the 2008 financial crisis and was approaching a “normal” level.
articles.abstract: Jerome H. Powell, the Federal Reserve chairman, said the economy had strengthened significantly since the 2008 financial crisis and was approaching a “normal” level.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve raised interest rates on Wednesday and signaled that two additional increases were on the way this year, as officials expressed confidence that the United States economy was strong enough for borrowing costs to rise without choking off economic growth.
articles.byline: By Jim Tankersley and Neil Irwin

articles.headline: AT&T-Time Warner Decision Shows Need to Rethink Antitrust Laws
articles.snippet: Antitrust experts say the enforcement of laws governing mergers should be updated to reflect major changes to the economy over the past 40 years.
articles.abstract: Antitrust experts say the enforcement of laws governing mergers should be updated to reflect major changes to the economy over the past 40 years.
articles.lead_paragraph: The last time there was an antitrust ruling as important as the one handed down Tuesday by Judge Richard J. Leon, cellphones didn’t exist. There was no such thing as the internet. Personal computers were years away from mass adoption.

articles.headline: A Macy’s Goes From Mall Mainstay to Homeless Shelter
articles.snippet: As traditional retailers fade in the era of Amazon, a vacant department store near Washington becomes a refuge for people struggling to find affordable places to live.
articles.abstract: As traditional retailers fade in the era of Amazon, a vacant department store near Washington becomes a refuge for people struggling to find affordable places to live.
articles.lead_paragraph: ALEXANDRIA, Va. — Karleen Smith used to work at the Macy’s in Landmark Mall, putting price tags on summer dresses, housewares and the latest styles of shoes.
articles.byline: By Michael Corkery and Andrew Mangum
